header.title: Introduction
header.content:
Leosphere Web API architecture

Based on simple REST principles, the Leosphere Web API is organized around 5 categories of actions:

  • Authentication : Connection management.
  • Data : Wind and aerosols data retrieval.
  • Monitoring : Lidar's monitoring through status , activities environmental data and logs retrieval.
  • Configuration : scans, settings and resolution management.
  • Control : Lidar's acquisition control and programming.

The Leosphere Web API is based on REST principles. Data resources are accessed via standard HTTP requests in UTF-8 encoding to a server hosted in the PC of the Lidar. The base address of Leosphere Web API is http://host, where “host” is your Lidar IP address. All requests to Leosphere Web API require authentication. This is achieved by sending a valid access token in the request header. Only Expert accounts have the right to use the API. Despite our efforts on creating, reviewing and validating this API and its documentation, should you notice any bug, typo error, or have any feedback, please contact our technical support team at support@leosphere.com.

Syntax generic principles

Most of the requests respond with JSON data, but some respond with binary data (files). In this documentation, all parameters in URL ending with an interrogation mark, are optional. An object is a dataset of both properties and values. It is represented in JSON by { “property1”: “value1”, “property2”:”value2”}. An object[] is an array of this kind of object, represented in JSON by [{“commonProperty”:”value1”}, {“commonProperty”:”value2”}].

HTTPS

The web server hosted by the Lidar is not able to use HTTPS yet. This feature will be released as soon as possible. In the meantime, we highly recommend you to use this API on protected network or behind a HTTPS protected reverse proxy, to avoid any man-in-the-middle security breach. For such reason, Leosphere can in no manner be held responsible in case of loss and/or leakage of data.

Available requests

Group Request Type Version
authentication /authentication/login POST v1
authentication /authentication/refresh_token GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/activity/:start_time/:end_time GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/devices_status GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/devices_status/:start_time/:end_time GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/environmental_data/:start_time/:end_time GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/global_status GET v1
monitoring /monitoring/logs GET v1
data /data/netcdf_file/:sweep_index/:groups GET v1
data /data/current_sweep_index GET v1
data /data/sweep_by_id/:sweep_index/:group/:variable? GET v1
data /v1/data/last_ray/radial_wind_data GET v1
data /data/sweep_list/:start_time/:end_time GET v1
data /data/netcdf_file/:sweep_index/:groups GET v1
configuration /configuration/lidar GET v1
configuration /configuration/resolution_list GET v1
configuration /configuration/scan_list GET v1
configuration /configuration/settings_list GET v1
configuration /configuration/scan_parameters/:id? GET v1
configuration /configuration/settings/:id? GET v1
configuration /configuration/save_composite POST v1
configuration /configuration/save_from_scan/:id POST v1
control /control/program POST v1
control /control/command/:action POST v1

Data groups

To ease data retrieval and homogenize with Windforge FTP data extraction in NetCDF file format, wind and aerosols data have been grouped in the following categories.

Group Available variables
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed
radial_wind_data doppler_spectrum_width
radial_wind_data doppler_spectrum_mean_error
radial_wind_data cnr
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed_ci
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed_status
wind_reconstruction_data horizontal_wind_speed
wind_reconstruction_data vertical_wind_speed
wind_reconstruction_data wind_direction
wind_reconstruction_data wind_speed_ci
wind_reconstruction_data wind_speed_status
radial_beta_data relative_beta,
radial_beta_data radial_wind_speed_status
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_x_max
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_y_average
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_amplitude
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_half_height_width
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_status
radial_absolute_beta_data absolute_beta
radial_absolute_beta_data radial_wind_speed_status
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_x_max
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_y_average
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_amplitude
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_half_height_width
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_status
atmospherical_structure_data atmospherical_structures_type. Cf NetCDF documentation in the user manual for more details.

When a request mentions in its input parameters, group or variable like for example GET /data/sweep_by_id/:sweep_index/:group/:variable? these groups and variable must be used

Error management

Below is the list of errors that can occur:

Error code Error Detailed explanation Troubleshooting
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given data group 'group' Check group name
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given field: {FIELD} Check field name.
400 parameter_not_valid This group is not available for last ray request
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given field 'field' for group 'group'
400 parameter_not_valid Start time not valid Check if time follows ISO8601 format ( YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ)
400 parameter_not_valid End time not valid Check if time follows ISO8601 format ( YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ)
400 parameter_not_valid Start time must be older than end time
400 parameter_not_valid Id has not the right format. Should be an integer
400 parameter_not_valid 'action' not valid Check available parameters in the documentation of the request.
400 parameter_not_valid 'loop' must be an array of objects Check if "[" and "]" exists. Must not be null if scheduler is not.
400 parameter_not_valid 'scheduler' must be an array of objects or null Check if "[" and "]" exists.
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown field 'wrongField' in loop at object #N Check field syntax for the line number N
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown field 'wrongField' in scheduler at object #N Check field syntax for the line number N
400 parameter_not_valid Missing field 'field' in loop at object #N Check available parameters in the documentation of the request.
400 parameter_not_valid Missing field 'field' in scheduler at object #N Check available parameters in the documentation of the request.
400 parameter_not_valid 'loop' must contain at least one scan Loop must not be null.
400 parameter_not_valid Value of field 'scan_id' in loop at object #N is not in the correct format Check if scan_id or iterations are integers, positive
400 parameter_not_valid Value of field 'scan_id' in scheduler at object #N is not in the correct format Check if it's an integer, positive if the format is wrong for scan_id ,iteration or period. Check if timestamp follows ISO8601 format or is greater than present time if start_time is wrong.
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' in loop at object #N does not exist Check if scan exists in library. Only the latest version of the scans are allowed.
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' in scheduler at object #N does not exist Check if scan exists in library. Only the latest version of the scans are allowed.
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot start a calibration scan
400 parameter_not_valid Object #1 and object #2 in scheduler have the same start time and period
400 parameter_not_valid 'sweep_index' has not the right format. Should be an integer greater than or equal to 1
400 parameter_not_valid 'id' has not the right format. Should be an integer greater than or equal to 1
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot edit a Calibration scan
400 parameter_not_valid Input data must be an object not empty
400 parameter_not_valid 'parameter' cannot be changed
400 parameter_not_valid Scan must not be a composite
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' does not exist
400 parameter_not_valid Field 'field' not allowed for this sweep mode
400 parameter_not_valid Field 'field' does not follow scan rules
400 parameter_not_valid Resolution with id 'X' does not exist
400 parameter_not_valid 'parent_scan_name' property is missing or its value is not a string
400 parameter_not_valid Composite must contain at least one 'elementary_scan'
400 parameter_not_valid An elementary scan must contain two properties: 'scan_id' and 'iterations' which are integers greater or equal to 1
400 parameter_not_valid Scan with id 'X' is a composite This scan can't be modified with this request. Use /configuration/save_composite instead
401 token_not_valid Use the correct token , or log again
401 wrong_user_name_or_pwd Check user name and password
401 account_inactive_for_too_long An expert account user needs to reactiv account
403 no_access_right Only expert users or more are allowed to connect.
412 connection_rejected A user is already operating the Lidar Check if someone has already taken system control
412 no_action_done State requested is the current one Check the Lidar's state
412 no_action_done Status is CRITICAL: acquisition can't be launched Solve the CRITICAL status before

Some example of these errors are given below in this document.
